content.body: The latest commit to the HTML spec left one uppercase occurrence of "Get Trusted Type" (the only one with an embedded newline), which I'm guessing was an oversight. Line 124289-90. foolip ?
content.formatted_body: The latest commit to the HTML spec left one uppercase occurrence of "Get Trusted Type" (the only one with an embedded newline), which I'm guessing was an oversight. Line 124289-90. foolip ?

content.body:
How so? https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-focus has:

> If options["focusVisible"] is true, or does not exist but in an implementation-defined way the user agent determines it would be best to do so, then indicate focus.

So if it's `false`, then you don't indicate focus, right?
content.formatted_body:
How so? https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-focus has:

If options["focusVisible"] is true, or does not exist but in an implementation-defined way the user agent determines it would be best to do so, then indicate focus.

So if it's false, then you don't indicate focus, right?

content.body: Note the test resets the focus state between steps too
Yep, definitely accidental. If you have it up on your screen can you send a PR that I can merge?
